Three generations of a family living on South India’s Malabar Coast suffer the loss of a family member by drowning. Read by the author. 31 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.

The comedic actress shares impactful experiences from her childhood in Australia to more recent obstacles in life. Read by the author. 10 hours, 48 minutes unabridged.
Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.

The CNN host draws out lessons for the present polarized era from the 17th-century Netherlands, the French Revolution and the Industrial Revolution. Read by the author. 13 hours, 2 minutes unabridged.

A trove of items collected by the Pulitzer Prize-winning historian’s late husband inspired an appraisal of central figures and pivotal moments of the 1960s. Read by Bryan Cranston and the author. 17 hours, 38 minutes unabridged.

The Grammy Award-winning pop star details her personal and professional experiences, including the years she spent under a conservatorship overseen by her father. Read by Michelle Williams. 5 hours, 31 minutes unabridged.

When aircraft from rival nations have a midair collision and the Campus is attacked, Jack Ryan Jr. tries to avert a war.
Jess has suspicions about her half-brother’s eclectic and unfriendly neighbors when he goes missing.
A woman from San Francisco falls for a horse rancher who is engaged to another woman.

After escaping a prison somewhere south of the Rio Grande, Hack Long and his outlaws look to get back their ill-gotten gains.

books.bookDescription: Two western stories: “Smoke Jensen: The Beginning” and “Luke Jensen, Bounty Hunter.”
